Verification of equilibration was determined by comparison between a batch isotherm method using a sealed glass ampoule system for long term (weeks) sorption and the sequential sorption isotherm method using the Micromeritics ASAP 2010 instrument, each at a mid-point temperature of 35°C. Sorption onto mineral materials Sorption isotherms onto 6X75 using TCE for three low and three high experimental temperatures are shown in Fig. 1 a and b, respectively. Since 6X75 is a microporous material, the Dubinin–Raduskevich and Dubinin–Astahkov micropore models were used to fit all sorption isotherms. Characteristic curves were defined separately for the two sets of experimental temperatures for comparison with coated materials (high and low temperatures).
